paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant A97D (p.A117D) including clinical significance, patient details, penetrance data, and functional data.

patients.phenotype: sporadic ATTRv amyloidosis with asymmetric neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: asymmetric neuropathy, unintentional weight loss, mild autonomic failure, mild cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We herein report a 68-year-old Japanese man with sporadic variant transthyretin (ATTRv) amyloidosis harboring the novel variant A97D (p.A117D) in TTR.

functional_data.summary: In silico analyses predicted that TTR A97D (p.A117D) altered the structure and function of the TTR protein.
assays: bioinformatics tools (PolyPhen-2, SIFT, Mutation Tester, CADD, M-CAP)

variants.segregation_data: Not applicable as this is a sporadic case.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in disease-causing variant databases or healthy individual databases.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on bioinformatics predictions and conservation across species.
variants.additional_notes: The A97D (p.A117D) mutation has not been described in disease-causing variant databases.
key_quotes: The A117 amino acid is highly conserved across various species.

We therefore investigated the gastric and duodenal mucosal biopsy specimens using laser microdissection and liquid-chromatography tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) to analyze the composition rate of variant TTR (D117) and wild-type TTR (A117) in the amyloid fibrils.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant A97D (p.A117D) was successfully extracted.
